default_definition.description: The specific criteria for default (e.g., 90 Days Past Due, bankruptcy, or unlikeliness to pay).

observation_period.description: The historical look-back period used for calibration.
observation_period.example: At least 5 years as per Basel standards

low_default_portfolio_flag.description: Whether the portfolio has very few defaults, requiring alternative calibration techniques (e.g., Pluto-Tasche).

recovery_period.description: The maximum time window allowed for recoveries to be considered in the LGD calculation under AIRB framework.

discount_rate.description: The rate used to discount future recoveries back to the date of default for AIRB compliance.

workout_strategy.description: The approach for managing defaulted exposures (e.g., repossession, restructuring).

conversion_factor.description: The method for calculating credit conversion factors for off-balance sheet exposures.

exposure_at_default_calculation.description: The methodology for calculating EAD at the time of default.
exposure_at_default_calculation.example: Current outstanding + CCF applied to undrawn commitments

commitment_period.description: The time horizon for commitment facilities under AIRB.

default_definition.description: The specific criteria for default under IFRS 9 (typically 90 days past due or other evidence).
default_definition.example: 90 DPD or reasonable probability of default

staging_criteria.description: The criteria for classifying exposures into Stage 1, 2, or 3.
staging_criteria.example: Stage 1: <30 DPD, Stage 2: 30-90 DPD, Stage 3: >90 DPD

lifetime_pd_requirement.description: Requirements for lifetime PD estimation for Stage 2 and 3 exposures.
lifetime_pd_requirement.example: 12-month PD for Stage 1, Lifetime PD for Stage 2-3

recovery_period.description: The maximum time window allowed for recoveries to be considered in the LGD calculation.

discount_rate.description: The rate used to discount future recoveries back to the date of default (usually Effective Interest Rate).

forward_looking_scenarios.description: The macroeconomic scenarios (Base, Upside, Downside) and their respective weightings.

exposure_measurement.description: How EAD is measured under IFRS 9 for expected credit loss calculations.
exposure_measurement.example: Gross carrying amount less credit risk adjustments

contractual_cash_flows.description: The contractual cash flows used in EAD calculations.

prepayment_assumptions.description: Assumptions about prepayment behavior affecting EAD.

legal_default_criteria.description: Legal criteria for determining default in adjudication context.

evidence_requirements.description: Evidence needed to support default determination for legal purposes.
evidence_requirements.example: Default notices, payment history, legal documents

jurisdictional_rules.description: Specific jurisdictional rules affecting default determination.

legal_recovery_process.description: Legal process requirements for recovery calculations.

court_costs.description: Treatment of legal and court costs in LGD calculations.
court_costs.example: Include attorney fees, filing costs, court expenses

settlement_timeline.description: Expected timeline for legal settlement and recovery.

legal_exposure_definition.description: Legal definition of exposure at default for adjudication purposes.
legal_exposure_definition.example: Total claim amount including interest and penalties

contingent_liabilities.description: Treatment of contingent liabilities in EAD calculations.
contingent_liabilities.example: Guarantees, letters of credit, legal claims

interest_accrual.description: How interest accrues post-default for legal calculations.
interest_accrual.example: Statutory interest rate or contractual rate
